data.title: Magna's Q3 2025 results: Sales up 2% to $10.5B, Adjusted EBIT $613M, Diluted EPS at $1.08, Adjusted diluted EPS $1.33, positive performance boosts confidence. Strategic decisions include Increase 2025 Sales outlook, Normal Course Issuer Bid to buy 10% of Common Shares.
data.description: Magna International Inc. reported strong performance in the third quarter of 2025 compared to the same period in 2024. Sales increased by 2% to $10.5 billion, supported by a 3% rise in global light vehicle production. Income from operations before income taxes was $473 million, down 32%, and Adjusted EBIT increased by 3% to $613 million, with an improvement in the Adjusted EBIT margin. Diluted earnings per share were $1.08, while Adjusted diluted earnings per share rose by 4% to $1.33. Net income attributable to Magna International Inc. was $305 million for the quarter. The company also announced an increased outlook for sales, Adjusted EBIT margin, and Adjusted Net Income. Additionally, the board approved a Normal Course Issuer Bid to repurchase up to 10% of public float Common Shares. The company's CEO, Swamy Kotagiri, expressed confidence in the company's strategic positioning and execution amid evolving macroeconomic trends. Going forward, Magna anticipates robust free cash flow to support future growth opportunities and reinforce a disciplined approach to capital allocation.
ECB Survey: Employment outlook remains relatively subdued; wage growth moderating.
ECB Survey: longer-term inflation expectation unchanged at 2%.
ECB Survey: gdp growth seen at 1.1% next year, 1.4% in 2027; both unchanged.

data.title: Amentum wins prime positions on multi-billion pound Sellafield decommissioning framework for 15 years.
data.description: CHANTILLY, Virginia - Amentum, traded on the NYSE as AMTM, has successfully obtained spots on a new multi-billion pound framework for providing specialized decommissioning services at the Sellafield nuclear site in the UK. The Decommissioning and Nuclear Waste Partnership (DNWP) spans 15 years and entails Amentum conducting remediation activities on inactive structures and extracting dangerous waste from historic ponds at the Cumbria-based site in England. Following a rigorous competitive bidding process, Amentum was chosen by Sellafield Ltd for the significant project.

data.title: Xairos, supported by ESA, moves to Phase 2 with partners ViaSat and Heriot-Watt Univ in Navigation Program.
data.description: Xairos, leading as the primary contractor for the Navigation Innovation & Support Program under ESA, has revealed Phase 2 in collaboration with ViaSat and Heriot-Watt University in London. The project aims to enhance navigation technologies with a focus on AltGPS.

data.title: European companies are utilizing AI to transform contact center experiences, creating unified service delivery platforms. #AI #Europe #ContactCenter
data.description: In Europe, companies are revolutionizing customer experience operations through advanced, cloud-based platforms that streamline service delivery, according to ISG. The integration of automated technologies is increasing efficiency and enhancing customer satisfaction. The shift towards these innovative solutions reflects a growing trend in the region.

data.title: $825M liquidation hits crypto market due to altcoin declines, with long positions most affected, per CoinMarketCap data.
data.description: Altcoins in the cryptocurrency market saw a notable downturn, resulting in $825 million worth of liquidations. Long positions bore the brunt of this trend, as reported by CoinMarketCap.

data.title: Nvidia to supply 260,000 AI chips to South Korean govt, Samsung, Hyundai, SK Group. Government to use 50,000 chips.
data.description: Nvidia Corporation has signed a deal to provide more than 260,000 AI chips to the South Korean government and major corporations like Samsung, Hyundai, and SK Group. The government will use over 50,000 chips for AI infrastructure, while the companies plan to deploy up to 50,000 chips in their smart factories focusing on semiconductor and vehicle production. Other partners include NAVER, Korea Institute of Science and Technology Information, and Kakao Corp. This partnership aims to drive global transformation through the production of intelligence as a new export.
